intro: Rotheca reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed rotheca, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. Rotheca reflexa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
